page.title: 14Southampton's River Test 3
page.content: More observations from{Lower Test {Valley Nature Reserve. { **** INSECTS **** } "I saw beautiful{dragonflies}over the river. They were blue and silvery with delicate wings. They played chase in and out of the riverbank plants." "I caught 12{grasshoppers}. Their bodies are green with a black line along the back. Their back legs are brown and sit up like a triangle." "The{Meadow Brown butterfly}has a brown body. The wings are brown and orange and semi-circular. There are dots on the wings like eyes. It looked furry and fluttered about on flowers." { **** FLOWERS **** "The best flowers I saw were orange and yellow, called{Birdsfoot trefoil} or 'bacon and eggs' as we call them. I like the shapes of the flower head. It reminds me of a bursting sun."
